website_summaries.verdict: The Keen Montford fits like a charm and feels like a dream. This ruggedly-handsome sneaker provides excellent comfort for activities that require much walking, lifting, or standing up. It is deceptively light, contains a sturdy construction, and very breathable. It also boasts of superior traction on most surfaces.This silhouette features the classic Keen roomy toe box. It runs true to length and provides good support for the feet. The only thing people expressed dissatisfaction with the most in this sneaker is the limited selection of colors available.
pros: According to most reviewers, the Keen Montford offers a high level of comfort
The shoe requires no break-in period and feels “phenomenal” on the feet even after a long day of walking or standing up
Many people loved the fit of the casual low-top sneaker
They said the footwear gave the toes plenty of room to breathe and provided wide feet with a comfortable fit
The silhouette runs true to size according to plenty of testers
The Montford is a durable shoe that can handle casual to moderate activities such as light hiking on easy to moderate trails, reported several consumers
One person also described how his pair looked barely worn in even after six months of use
A good number of users remarked that the lifestyle footwear by Keen was well-made and worth every cent
A handful of purchasers liked the rugged yet fashionable styling of the low-top shoe
The Keen Montford is a deceptively light sneaker which makes it ideal for walking around in all day, some buyers stated
The lifestyle footwear feels cool and breathable on the feet in warm weather, a few individuals commented
Two persons claimed that the casual shoe provided good support for the feet, even for people with plantar fasciitis
The Montford has a grippy sole that is excellent on most but the slickest of surfaces
One person mentioned that the sneaker kept his feet dry during a rainstorm
cons: A few people expressed dissatisfaction that the Keen Montford silhouette has limited colorways
One person was unhappy that the sole of the shoe leaves marks on tile floors
A user reported that laces are tough to pull through the shoe’s eyelets

customer_reviews.title: Fits like the old Keens
customer_reviews.text: Keen recently changed their shoes dramatically. I used to be able to walk out of REI with a size 9.5 men's Keen of any style and feel confident they would fit. Typically there wasn't even a break-in period even for their hiking boots. But now even with styles I've been buying for years, I had to go up to a size 11M to keep my toe from contacting the tip of the boot. Of course, at that size, the boot didn't fit the rest of my foot. These Montfords fit the closest to the old Keens. I used Amazon Wardrobe to get 5 different styles of Keens and kept these.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a problem with shoes hurting the bottom of his feet, also needs really good ankle support. These shoes are the best he has found that are comfortable, but support his ankles. He wears them hiking and everyday working in his shop standing on cement. I just ordered him a second pair for good. These shoes are the best, thank you Keens! We have wasted a lot of money on expensive shoes that didn't work like these Keens have!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moss

customer_reviews.title: WIDE FEET, Good not great but I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: I have extremely wide/flat feet so I tend to buy Keen mostly. The Keen Rialto fits me perfectly. This shoe is not quite as wide but is sufficient to be comfortable. I wear a 13 and bought a 13 - other than being a tiny bit narrower than the Rialto it fits as expected. After wearing all day my small outside toe will begin to ache but for 6 hours or less they are fine. They breath much better than the all leather Rialto, which is why I bought them. I have had them since October 2018 and they are holding up great to daily use around town. I'm happy, I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These Keen shoes have been fantastic!! They have plenty of toe room and I can wear my custom orthotics in them. Very comfortable. Just a little warm for Summer but other than that they have worked extremely well for me. I love the extra support of the metal arch that was lacking in my previous shoes which lost support after 6 months. I would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: redcloud9

customer_reviews.title: They were recommended by a doctor for his feet/back and are wide ...
customer_reviews.text: My partner has had 3 pair of these (in different colors), now. He continuously wears one pair every day without rotation. They were recommended by a doctor for his feet/back and are wide enough to not rub funny in any one spot. It seems the inner shoes wears out faster than the outer shoe, and with the three pair - only one was in a specific place. The other two have just been overall wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: bassoon713

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes are like obscenity: I can't define it, but I know it when I see it.  These shoes are obscene.
customer_reviews.text: Once again, Keen makes a shoe that feels as though someone snuck into my bedroom one night, measured my feet, and made me a custom pair of shoes. Keen is the only brand I'd ever considering buying without trying them on first. Wide enough for my Charlie Brown "as wide as they are long" feet and a big toe box so I can tap my toes to music without anyone but me ever knowing. Keen makes consistently comfortable, and consistently goofy-looking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck E. Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality construction. Soles separate from upper in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Do Not Buy. I bought a pair and in a short time the upper began to separate from the sole at the instep by the ball of my foot. I love Keene shoes and never had a problem like this so I put it down to random happenstance and bought another pair for a business trip to China. Within three weeks the new pair failed in the same place, with the upper separating from the sole. These shoes are defective and I would recommend against purchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: Brazuka

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is fine but the color is not the same as the photo.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes solely based on the color in the photo. The picture shows a nice golden beautiful brown. In actuality it's more of a darker greenish brown and I'll be returning them as I have no need for more shoes if the color isn't right. I have several pairs of Keen shoes and am not rating the quality of the shoe as Keen is a great brand, but I'm disappointed the shoes aren't true to the color of the photo.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyAngel

customer_reviews.title: I love Keen's steel toed shoes as they have a wide ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen's steel toed shoes as they have a wide toe box and are ideal for that. However , this pair and the Voyagers I have just don't do it for me. They COULD be perfect. I love the wide toe box but the heel is too loose. Not snug enough. I can also say that the material quality could use some improvement. All of my Keen's have ripped / torn on the inside heel. Perhaps because of the loose fitting heel I suppose. Also the laces broke on my Atlanta Cool's within a few months.
customer_reviews.author: D. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit for Slightly Wider Foot
customer_reviews.text: I am very hard to please when it comes to my shoes. My feet feel everything and affect my well-being. Keen seems to be the ticket for my wider feet and the line of work I am in where I'm on my feet all day. Have worn Keens for years; tried the Montford, Magnet for the first time. They are true to size (slightly wide as needed), comfortable especially in toe area, no rubbing at ankles, and I like that they don't look awkward or too large. Just wish they weren't so pricey since I go through shoes quickly. :)
customer_reviews.author: DeZinr

customer_reviews.title: Look great. Hurt my heels/ cant wear them.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great and have the classic keen wideness and feel in the toebox. Unfortunately, I dont know if I just got a bad set but they are the most uncomfortable shoes Ive ever owned. Especially the left, but both really hurt the heels of my feet, like the footbed of the shoe is too curved or something. I didnt figure this out for a while unfortunately as I hoped they just needed to break in. I cant wear them. I love keens in general and have gone through many sets.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable footwear
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. These are my second pair. Only my second pair because my first pair lasted me 2 years and they still are not fully worn out. They last. I am 270 lbs so I am putting alot of force on these shoes. The toe box is bigger than standard shoes. They are great for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin G.

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I usually have to hunt for a double- or triple-E shoe when purchasing any other brand of recreational shoe, but since I bought my first pair of Keens a couple years ago, my problem is solved. These shoes are listed as medium, but have plenty of room for the front of my feet/toes. Very comfortable and look great besides. Fit "as I hoped they would". I'm a Keen guy for life now. No question that "you get what you pay for", and the fast delivery was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Garwood

customer_reviews.title: Good all-around shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are lighter and more flexible than the Saltzman and the Oakridge. They're also breathable, so they're good for walking, light hiking, and even casual wear. They're perfect to wear on vacation, because they don't get too hot, and if we end up taking the dogs on a six-mile walk that doesn't require hiking boots, these shoes work good for that.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Good Keen shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Keen shoes for years, require a larger toe box which Keens have supplied. These shoes came through the same way and I've been wearing them a lot since receiving them a few days ago. Understand from other reviews that Keens are no longer made in the USA. Whatever, these fit me as expected. Hopefully they'll last as long as the others.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Fit was true to size.
customer_reviews.text: For ordering sight unseen, this order worked out okay. I do wish there were retail outlets nearby where I could try the shoes on before buying. The shoes are comfortable and fit surprisingly well -- my toes are right at the end, but not so much as to be negative. I like KEEN shoes and will continue to try and find good fits.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Wide foot pocket
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair elsewhere and liked them so much I purchased another from Amazon. The foot pocket is VERY wide which is great. I used them on a trip to Paris where I walked all day for miles and miles. It was somewhat hot and I kept thinking how comfortable my feet were. I have a bit of Neuropathy in my feet and these fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: RBO

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a different shoe than the last pair I bought?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this exact same shoe. I'm in construction and they hold up to that well but it seems like this pair compared to last has very little padding in the sole and my feet are worn out ant the end of the day. I still have the old pair and have tried to figure it out but I guess maybe they are making the sole liner thinner? Not a deal breaker but I probably won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Macomber

customer_reviews.title: Well made shoe, NOT made in USA. They need to remove this from description.
customer_reviews.text: These are wide and short. Appear to be a well made shoe. Does not squeeze toes together at tip. My only problem with these is the FALSE ADVERTISING that they (might be) Made in the USA. They are made in Vietnam.
customer_reviews.author: HdRidesOnX

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable walking shoes - great for wider feet too
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves these - he has wide feet but a medium in this shoe is perfect. Bought originally because he forgot his walking shoes on a recent trip and had to find something to wear. Ordered a second pair just because they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JadeJ

customer_reviews.title: Hands-down my favorite sneaker
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of the shoes that I’ve purchased in the past six years, hands-down my favorite sneakers! I’m very hard on shoes so to find a pair that will last me about two years at a clip is very rare, I also have flat feet with almost no arch and the sneakers are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Winter is coming

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I now own two pairs of these shoes (different colors)! These shoes are incredibly comfortable! The one weakness I've found is that the tongue of the shoes (both pairs and both the left and right shoes) tend to slide to the side. I have found that if I pull the top of the tongue above the laces edge, and tie just below the top of the tongue, it prevents the tongue from sliding to the side. This is a little annoying, but the comfort of the shoes far exceeds this minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chalkman

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable. Just love these shoes. Tons of space in the toe box but still a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: TausMan

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy these shoes again
customer_reviews.text: I work in construction and all the keens that I have ever bought were solid for a minimum of 6 months these just ripped out a little over 2 months of non-everyday use I will never buy these shoes again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which I like a lot
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is generous, which I like a lot. The width overall is maybe a little wider than I like but not a show stopper. I need a little more arch support than these provide so I added a store-bought insert which solved it. Overall I really like these shoes but I can't give them 5 stars for the aforementioned reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve own several pairs of Keen shoes and these did not disappoint. They are wider in the toe area than most shoes which is a perfect fit for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Danell

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Keen shoes are outstanding and these were no exception. This brand is all I've worn for years. These generally last 3-4 years and I wear them constantly. Love love them!
customer_reviews.author: KatieGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I own several Keen's and I really like this shoe. I haven't had them long enough to determine how tough they'll be but for comfort they are top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: D. Platt

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: My favorite casual shoe. Comfortable with a large toe box, and lasts well. My third pair. Also like that there's minimal heel.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: You had the size we needed
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to find a men's size 17 shoe that fits the foot well and doesn't hurt!! Thank you :)
customer_reviews.author: Conni Katke

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and extremely durable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and Keen shoes always fit me perfectly. The toe-box is roomy, it's just the way they're made. Do you find the standard "D" width to be too narrow? Are you frustrated that shoe producers offer only one width? If so you should try Keen. Comfortable and extremely durable shoes, I've been wearing them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Don Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with the shoes. I got them a size too big and they are a size too big. For me this means walking around leisurely and very comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Marcell B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes that are comfortable and have held up great with daily use for 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kaster Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it and I’ll purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: 0ded Rotholz

customer_reviews.title: ...just not for me...
customer_reviews.text: good shoe but for some reason just didn't fit me well. I usually wear 11.5 EE, flat footed. Ordered 11.5 first time around, just slightly too short. Returned those and ordered 12, too big. Like I said just not a good fit for me personally. Ill be returning these but I'm not giving up on KEEN just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Olvera

customer_reviews.title: These fit great & I like the dressy look --- could be ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear only Keen shoes. These fit great & I like the dressy look --- could be worn with dress slacks.
customer_reviews.author: oxford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son as a work shoe- he loves the comfort. May buy another pair
customer_reviews.author: Marian H.

customer_reviews.title: Fit and style were perfect for my tastes!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding comfort from the get go! Highly recommended, 0 breaking in needed. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fred V.

customer_reviews.title: love it and the price
customer_reviews.text: I know the brand and size and quality, love it and the price!! Shipping to the house is awesome too!
customer_reviews.author: alan mydland

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but VERY hot.
customer_reviews.text: Keen makes great shoes, they are well built and fit well. My only minus would be these are very hot. I wore in cooler fall temps and my feet a tad on the toasty/hot side. I will definitely be wearing these when it is super cold outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mikehill33

customer_reviews.title: Poor preformance
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes but...... After 7 months the pad inside is rolling around the toe areas on both shoes giving it the feeling of your socks being rolled up under the balls of your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Berg

customer_reviews.title: Ran very big for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes but I had to return two pairs due to the size. I normally wear 9.5. I ordered a 9...to big. Ordered 8.5...still to big. Finally ordered a size 8 and they are a little snug but fit the best. I would say they run at least 1 size to big
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best sneakers I’ve ever owned, felt broken in right away. A true joy to wear, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN PLANT

customer_reviews.title: Great trekking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit great, good roomy toe box! I liked them so much as my newest trekking shoe for cobblestones in Italy hill towns, I bought a second pair for when these wear out so I'll have backup!
customer_reviews.author: frugal shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe. Plenty of support nice and wide
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe. Plenty of support nice and wide, but I ordered the next size up As I have wide feet ( for example if you wear 10.5 order an 11). The fit is good. Seems like a sturdy shoe and didn't need much break in time. These are more of an around town with lite hiking rather than a true outdoors shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Remington Steel

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but I returned them because my other Keen ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but I returned them because my other Keen shoes (4 pair over the last two years) were all splitting on the same spot year after year. I sill like their sandals but am done buying their shoes
customer_reviews.author: Cypress House

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need the lower support, this is a very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to rate this shoe 5 stars as it has a very comfortable upper. Unfortunately for me, I need the support of a stiff lower as in the Targhee II line.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wide toe box
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who require a wide toe box, these are the shoes for you. They are very comfortable, have a good arch and low below the ankle so they don't rub. They are more than worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: 5th pair of Keen shoes.  Comfortable, rugged, quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of Keen shoes over approx 4 years. They're comfortable, look good. They tend to be rugged, well made and last well.
customer_reviews.author: MarcInWa

customer_reviews.title: These Keen shoes are a winner.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. He wears them all the time. They fit him just perfect and he says they are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ida M. Eardley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Husband keeps coming back to this brand and style as it is effective and comfortable for regular wear and hiking too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Keen delivers again!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few pairs of Keen shoes and have always been happy with them. I bought these for my son as he had been complaining of pain in his feet. I suspect suspected it was due to wearing shoes without support. All my Keen shoes have had great support and these are no exception. After a few weeks of wearing these he no longer is complaining of pain. While these fit fairly true to size over noticed Keen shoes have a larger toe box which is good for wider feet.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptical-Optimist

customer_reviews.title: I loved these shoes when i first got them
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes when i first got them, about 5 days ago. Now i am having to return them and they are out of my size. They are being returned as they tore along the stitching just below the laces on the outside of the shoe. There is a hole in the top material about the size of a nickel.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not as quality as Keens!
customer_reviews.text: Keens are usually the best shoes I wear, however their quality is lacking in this shoe. I like the shoes but will be more choosy next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight A. Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat a Keen shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable shoe that looks good too. As a person with narrow feet, it is hard finding shoes that are not only long enough but narrow enough too. Without being a B width, these shoes are narrow enough to give the proper feel. I can wear a Keen shoe all day and not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: good all around shoe
customer_reviews.text: could be a little less money but in this day/age you don't get much under $70
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: My normal size!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9 1/2 in my shoes. I read all the reviews and they said the sizes run big. So I ordered a 9 got it two days later and my toe just touched, then returned and reordered, the 9 1/2 fits perfectly. I love these, most comfortable shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: Clicklickboom

customer_reviews.title: Keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: Keens are great! I work on concrete all day and they are really top of the line!
customer_reviews.author: john spevak

customer_reviews.title: Way to large.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Keens for years and I've always worn a 10.5. My feet were swimming in them even with my heaviest hiking socks. Also the arch support hurt my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Berardino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Have fallen in love with these shoes! Had a pair of work boots and decided to but a pair of casual shoes and they are prefect!!
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are extremely comfortable. The toe box gives ample room and the shoes are comfy all day. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Gerb Bergen

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, sporty but can be worn with a sport coat.Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Its so so Had good feel but wears out very fast
customer_reviews.text: Its so so Had good feel but wears out very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Izadi

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but ran wide in size 13.
customer_reviews.text: I've only purchased Keen boots in the past and have loved them. I wear a 13 and they fit me well. This Montford shoe however ran wide.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: They fit very comfortably
customer_reviews.text: this is my second pair of keen shoes and just like the first pair these fit very well I would even buy another pair later
customer_reviews.author: David tarpley

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe right from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Keens, Very comfortable shoe right from the beginning. If this pair wears as well as my first pair I will be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: otherwise a fine shoe.
customer_reviews.text: the color is not as pictured. more of a greenish brown. very disappointing. otherwise a fine shoe.
customer_reviews.author: robert strawn

customer_reviews.title: light, large toe box
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, light, very comfortable shoe with a large toe box. Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Tucker B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and they are nice looking tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were a gift and he liked the shoes very much.
customer_reviews.author: M. Avila

customer_reviews.title: but this shoe has been awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I've had some keen shoes in the past that fell apart very quickly, but this shoe has been awesome.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 12, ordered a 12 and a 13 the 13 fit.
customer_reviews.author: MT director of fun

customer_reviews.title: Keens are my favorite shoe! Been wearing them for years
customer_reviews.text: Keens are my favorite shoe! Been wearing them for years. The pair I bought a decade ago are in just as good of shape my newer pairs are in. More than worth the $. They last forever. I don’t buy any other brand of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe, too bad the seams are poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Keen shoes were bulletproof. I bought this pair last year, but they did not last past 6 months. Unfortunately it happened past the Amazon return policy, so I am stuck with these defective shoes. The suede part tore along the seam on the inside right shoe. That's one of the flex points of the shoe. As you can see in the photos they are relatively new, and I did not stress them. Just work in an office job walking around. I have had good luck with their sandals, messenger bags, but their shoes are hit and miss when it comes to quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Breazile

customer_reviews.title: ... reputation for having plenty of arch support and a nice wide base for the foot sole
customer_reviews.text: In general KEEN has a reputation for having plenty of arch support and a nice wide base for the foot sole, both of which are things that I need. This shoe was no exception and is meeting my needs very well. I love the closed rubber toe and the breathability of this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Olson

customer_reviews.title: Okay shoe, but.....
customer_reviews.text: If you order this show, please order them one size larger than you need.
customer_reviews.author: Sketch

customer_reviews.title: warm shoes
customer_reviews.text: Don't wear these in the summer. These are cold weather shoes.
customer_reviews.author: James Z.

customer_reviews.title: Quality /Stylish
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing my previous worn identical Keen shoes. I like the style and looks as well as quality/durablity of Keen.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with keen shoes. I have a wide foot and they fit just right!
customer_reviews.author: J. Talone

customer_reviews.title: Little large but fit good much more comfortable then the shoes I had previously
customer_reviews.text: Little large but fit good much more comfortable then the shoes I had previously. Every keen shoe I get is alway high quality and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Cumfy
customer_reviews.text: Cumfy, nice fit with good toe room, soft mid soles as well as plenty of grip on the outer sole. Only disappointment was I was expecting the leather more recent upgrade version, and I got the synthetic older version. Hmmm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so should be good to go in winter
customer_reviews.text: A bit large for summer socks, but I wear 2 pairs of socks in winter-one pair wool, so should be good to go in winter. Otherwise fits good, especially for by high instep and wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: VIRGINIA ENGEBRETSEN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit But Get To Know The Keen Line of Shoes
customer_reviews.text: As has always been the case for me, Keen shoes feel wonderful on my feet. I think that you sort of need to get to know how the Keen shoes fit. For very many years I have almost always worn a 10.5. For some Keen shoes like my Keen hiking shoes the 10.5 works best for me. For this show and the Austin shoe the 10 is plenty large and a 10.5 would be larger than what I want. So, I would say that this shoe runs a little large but I was expecting that from my experience with the Austin shoe. I got lucky... the 10 is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable to walk in. I use sole inserts and they fit great also.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is my work shoe. It's the best one I have found. Very comfortable and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort and stability. Fits as comfortable as the sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Tartanterp

customer_reviews.title: Great casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. Great look & lightweight! I’d purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love Keens, but I always order 1/2 size larger than other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right out of the box and look great.
customer_reviews.author: james e young

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: KEEN Shoes have yet to disappoint me. This pair continues the streak.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: loosened up as I wore them still like to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Treash

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, I've owned Keens for years and these shoes are as advertised and look and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: but after some wear they did just fine. By the time we reached Giant's Causeway they ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after trying on many different shoes. I wanted low-tops that would be all-purpose shoes for a 11 day trip to Ireland. These did the trick. The tread is not as rugged as most hiking shoes, and was worried i might slip around. In Dublin they did seem to slip around a bit in the rain, but after some wear they did just fine. By the time we reached Giant's Causeway they were plenty grippy. Wasn't doing any major treks, longest day was just a little over 8 miles. I was comfortable the entire journey.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Best out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of shoes straight out of the box for comfort. I walk between 15000 and 20000 steps a day on my job at REI. These shoes fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: Richard B Weitzel

customer_reviews.title: very very comfortable and I will purchase them again
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, very very comfortable and I will purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Golightly

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is much too large without an extra insole ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is much too large without an extra insole. I have a wide foot, but this is closer to EEE. While I float in it I can't tell about arch support.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: The uppers are fine but the heels collapsed and my back hurts after ...
customer_reviews.text: Kind of flimsy. The soles are very soft and they collapsed after walking a few miles a day for a month. The uppers are fine but the heels collapsed and my back hurts after wearing them. I understand that they're not hiking boots but I was just wearing them as every day shoes and that was too much for them.
customer_reviews.author: J. NELSON

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Are comfy. I wear a size 12 in ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoes Are comfy. I wear a size 12 in Nike, but 11 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Hansen

customer_reviews.title: NICE LOOKING @ COMFORT INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: These are great casual work shoes, comfortable, flexible as well as seem so far to be pretty durable. I drive 18 wheels for a living, but when I jump down, I like to look good doing it....lol We where brown, so these coordinate with my uniform perfectly, plus I try to break the image of the typical truck driver look. So I raise the bar, and created a new" standard nice appearance, super clean, smelling good with a fresh" deck of KEENS...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Dog hair on returned shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is nice for all man made materials except for a small section of leather. Keens usually wear well and I expect nothing less of this pair. My particular pair was a return from somone else. They weren't used or worn outside as far as I can tell so there wasn't anything wrong with them. But they had dog hair all over them like the previous person had a dog that seriously sheds a lot. So that was kinda of a turnoff.
customer_reviews.author: Xandish

customer_reviews.title: Try a half size down
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe- very comfortable but the size 12 ran a tad larger than my other pairs of Keen shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's 1014365 Fashion Sneaker
product_meta.description: This sporty lace-up gets a major upgrade from full-grain leather and soft suede. A breathable mesh lining and microfiber-covered footbed kick up the comfort level.
